newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenia shares firm, seen rising in December.
newsitem.headline: Slovenia shares firm, seen rising in December.

text.p: Slovenian shares rose 1.28 percent on Friday as investors capitalised on low share prices due to political uncertainty as the country awaits the formation of a new government, traders said.
The market could rise further in December due to book balancing, they added.
"Current prices are considered to be low but their potential is limited due to the unclear political situation," one broker said.
* The 10-shares SBI index rose 14.61 points to 1,160.1
* Bank SKB had the higest turnover, closing 1.18 percent higher at 41,990 tolars on volume of 674 shares.
